Graphene

Visualizing algorithms' strengths and weakness in a dataset through Instance Space Analysis.

Graphene is an analytical tool designed to assist the understanding of the difficulty level of individual instances (Instance Hardness) in a dataset and also to trace regions where each algorithm is expected to perform well.

Demo Mode

Within this page you can visualize simple datasets and interact with their instance space representation. The 2D problems help to get insight into each hardness measure.

Try it
Graphene App

Explore the full power of the tool to analyze your own dataset. You can select points of high difficulty and download the corresponding instances. The footprint area helps you visualizing regions where an algorithm performed well or poorly.

Launch
Settings

Configure each step of the process, like hyper-parameter optimization for a better algorithm performance assessment; or feature selection to filter the best meta features. You can also choose which hardness measures to calculate and which algorithms to evaluate.

Configure
Instance Space Analysis

ISA gives insights into why some instances are "harder" than others, combining the information of meta-features and algorithm performance. To this end, an optimization problem is solved to find the mapping from the meta-features multidimensional space into a 2-D space, such that the distribution of algorithm performance metrics and meta-feature values across instances in the 2-D space display as much linear trend as possible to assist interpretation of hardness directions. The 2-D space can then be inspected for regions of good and bad algorithmic performance, with ML techniques used to predict areas of strength known as the algorithm footprint.
